results.abstract: Cmment on Aleksei Kovalev, who is flying airplanes in his spare time and approaching, literally, what his hockey style has always suggested: that he is a space cadet (S)

headline.main: The Rangers' Enigmatic Aleksei Kovalev Is Soaring to New Altitudes

results.snippet: Now that Aleksei Kovalev is flying airplanes in his spare time, he is approaching literally what his hockey style has always suggested in the figurative sense: that he is a space cadet, a daredevil Russian cosmonaut, drafted on the first round from...
results.lead_paragraph: Now that Aleksei Kovalev is flying airplanes in his spare time, he is approaching literally what his hockey style has always suggested in the figurative sense: that he is a space cadet, a daredevil Russian cosmonaut, drafted on the first round from Dynamo Moscow in June 1991. When Kovalev plays the way he did in the first two games of the Rangers road trip this week, there is only one question to ask: Who are the other candidates for the Hart Trophy as most valuable player in the National Hockey League? Unfortunately, Kovalev does not always play with the strength, skill and determination he showed in scoring two goals and assisting on another over two games on Wednesday and Thursday nights, a 3-1 defeat in Anaheim and a 5-1 victory in Los Angeles. Kovalev and the Rangers played last night in San Jose.
